title.narrative: Improving access to comprehensive primary health care services through supporting Aski Mosul , Tal Musa and Hedhayma helth facilities in Ninewa Governorate .

description.narrative: Ninewa Governorate is considered one of the main fields of Heevie Organization activities in the last 2 years Heevie is running 16 static health facilities and 2 Mobile Medical Units in the governorate. In the current project proposal, Heevie is aiming to support 3 health facilities within Ninewa, which are Hedhayma PHCC (Zummar sub district, Talafar district), Aski Mosul PHCC (Mosul district) in addition to Tal Musa Village health facility (Zummar subdistrict, Talafar district), which is chosen instead of Kakhurta PHCC since the last one was chosen mostly for stabilization and trauma care purposes as it was near the front lines close to Eyadhiya sub district, and since trauma stabilization activities are left for trauma group, Tal Musa was the location selected instead of it. The selected locations of Hedhayma, Aski Mosul and Tal Musa, were of the main drainage points for the IDPs during the previous wars and conflicts in the areas, currently, more than 600 IDP families (3600 people) habits the three locations and the villages surrounding them. It is also expected that many more IDPs will come towards the area after operations for liberating the western and the remaining northern Ninewa governorate will proceed. The IDP population is added to more than 19500 host community people who will be direct beneficiaries from the project. Heevie, through the proposed project, is aiming to provide essential lifesaving and primary health care services through the 3 mentioned health facilities (Tal Musa health facility is a prefab of 4 rooms provided by Heevie). The planned response that Heevie will perform is in regard to staffing, medications and medical equipment to respond to the new challenges due to the increasing needs of IDPs and host community in the region. Heevie will provide extra staff to the already existing staff supported by DoH Ninewa specially doctors, as none of these centers is currently provided with doctors, a situation which affects the availability, quality and continuity of the health services, in addition to direct support for their own staff according to the regulations of DoH Ninewa and Iraq Health cluster. The additional staff is required to perform all the necessary primary health care services and programs.
